column2: CALIFORNIA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: California
column6: CA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Which child requires a child restraint system?
column4: A six-year old who is 4 feet 10 inches tall
column6: A seven-year old who is 4 feet 7 inches tall
column8: An eight-year old who is 4 feet 9 inches tall

column2: 2. BAC is:
column4: the acronym for Beer ACcumulation.
column6: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column8: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 3. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.
column6: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
column8: can turn left. You have the right of way.

column2: 4. If your accelerator becomes stuck you should:
column4: turning the ignition off while the vehicle is moving.
column6: not apply the brakes. Ease off the gas pedal and straighten the front wheels.
column8: shift to neutral, apply the brakes, and try to drive the car safely off the road.

column2: 5. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
column4: accelerate much faster
column6: stop much more quickly
column8: stop much more slowly

column2: 6. If you drive at the posted speed limit, you can be given a speeding ticket:
column4: under no circumstances.
column6: if you are carrying more than one passenger.
column8: if road or weather conditions require a slower speed.

column2: 7. You want to park uphill on a two-way roadway and there is no curb. Which way do you turn your front wheels?
column4: So they face straight ahead.
column6: Left, towards the center of the road.
column8: Right, towards the side of the road.

column2: 8. You are entering a roundabout with multiple lanes, and you need to turn right at the intersection. You must:
column4: choose either lane, and exit in the lane you entered.
column6: choose the right-hand lane and exit in the right-hand lane.
column8: choose the left-hand lane and exit.

column2: 9. You must file a Report of Traffic Accident Occurring in California (SR 1) with DMV within 10 days if you:
column4: refinance the remaining balance of your vehicle loan.
column6: are in a collision that causes $750 in damage.
column8: plan on being out of the state for more than 45 days.

column2: 10. Which of the following roadways freezes first when wet?
column4: Tunnels
column6: Intersections
column8: Bridges and over-passes

column2: 11. This sign indicates:
column4: a side road.
column6: a cross road.
column8: a church zone ahead.

column2: 12. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column6: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.
column8: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.

column2: 13. Which way should your front wheels be turned when parked uphill next to a curb?
column4: Toward the curb.
column6: Parallel to the curb.
column8: Away from the curb.

column2: 14. You can drive off the road to pass another vehicle:
column4: if the vehicle ahead is turning left.
column6: if there are two or more lanes traveling in your direction.
column8: under no circumstances.

column2: 15. You are entering a roundabout with multiple lanes, and you need to go straight through the intersection. You must:
column4: choose either lane, and exit in the lane you entered.
column6: choose the right-hand lane and exit in the right-hand lane.
column8: choose the left-hand lane and exit.

column2: 16. When driving in fog, snow, or rain, you should use your:
column4: running lights.
column6: high-beam headlights
column8: low-beam headlights

column2: 17. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
column6: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
column8: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.

column2: 18. To safely back their vehicle, drivers should NOT:
column4: tap their horn before backing up.
column6: check their vehicle before they get in.
column8: look over their right shoulder as they back up.

column2: 19. If an oncoming vehicle has started to turn left in front of you:
column4: maintain your speed and take your right of way.
column6: honk your horn to warn the driver and maintain your speed.
column8: slow or stop to prevent a collision.

column2: 20. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column4: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.
column6: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column8: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.

column2: 21. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
column4: a crossbuck sign.
column6: a speed limit sign.
column8: an advance warning sign.

column2: 22. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a one lane bridge ahead.
column6: the right lane ends.
column8: the road ahead is narrow.

column2: 23. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.
column6: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column8: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 24. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column4: BEFORE you move.
column6: AFTER you move.
column8: if it’s raining.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column4: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.
column6: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.
column8: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.

column2: 26. Which statement is true about motorcyclists and motorists?
column4: Motorcyclists are heavier than other vehicles and are less affected by wind/rain.
column6: Motorcyclists are not allowed to drive faster than other traffic during congested road conditions.
column8: Motorcyclists have the same rights/responsibilities as other motorists.

column2: 27. The speed limit in any alley is:
column4: 25 MPH
column6: 20 MPH
column8: 15 MPH

column2: 28. You must yield to a pedestrian using a cane or guide dog:
column4: At all times.
column6: Only when a guide dog is leading the person across the street.
column8: Only if a crossing guard is present.

column2: 29. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.
column6: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
column8: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.

column2: 30. While driving, you should look 10 to 15 seconds ahead of you:
column4: because it’s a legal requirement.
column6: and focus on the middle of the road.
column8: to see potential hazards early.

column2: 31. You should allow more space in front of your vehicle when following large trucks because:
column4: if you follow too closely, you will get caught in the wind draft caused by the truck.
column6: you need the extra room to see around the truck.
column8: their heavier weight allows them to stop more quickly than you.

column2: 32. Once in the roundabout, drivers travel:
column4: in a counter-clockwise direction.
column6: in a clockwise direction.
column8: in both directions.

column2: 33. When driving at night with no other vehicles ahead, a driver should use:
column4: high beam lights.
column6: low-beam lights.
column8: parking lights.

column2: 34. California has a Basic Speed Law, which means that:
column4: drivers may never drive faster than is safe for current conditions.
column6: drivers can disregard the posted speed limit when it is raining, foggy, windy, snowing, or dusty.
column8: drivers must always drive at least 10 MPH less than the posted speed limit.

column2: 35. BAC is expressed in:
column4: ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column6: percentage of alcohol to blood.
column8: percentage of blood to alcohol.

column2: 36. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.
column6: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.
column8: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.
